li.a: Prohibition Against Illegal Discrimination and Harassment Grievance Form
Prohibition against discrimination, harassment, and retaliation policy
Want a Great Way to Track School Events?
Got Homework? Need Help? Read Below!

p.strong: Per Governor Parsons' state-wide orders, school will not be held within the North Platte R-I School District buildings for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We will, however, continue to provide appropriate course work and learning opportunities through the same platforms that we have been using during this closure until the originally scheduled last day of school, May 15. There are many questions right now about a wide variety of topics. We will be providing more information in those areas soon. Here is some quick information on a few topics of discussion:

*Graduation will not be held on May 10, 2020. The NP Board of Education will be discussing a possible date for this event with our administration at the BOE meeting on Wednesday night. It is our intent to hold Graduation at some point this summer.
*The Wednesday night board meeting will be held through the Zoom Application. We will be providing a link for those who are interested in following the meeting.
*We will continue to provide the child meals on Mondays, Wednesday, and Fridays through May 15.

*All junior high and high school spring athletics and activities have been cancelled per MSHSAA. I know this is very disappointing to our students, especially our seniors who have worked hard to prepare for one last season of athletics and activities.

*We do not have any real information on summer school at this time. We would like to hold summer school in some form. It is very important to get students back into classrooms learning and interacting with staff and their peers as soon as it is safe to do so.
*We do not have any information on summer camps or workouts for athletics or activities at this time. There is really no way to know if these opportunities will be allowed or not.

*We will be providing information next week on how students can pick up their belongings and clean out their lockers and desks. This will have to be done within the guidelines of social distancing so we are working on an efficient manner to accomplish this task.

*This has been a very difficult time for our entire country and the world. I want to thank everyone in our community for their flexibility in working with our staff to still provide educational opportunities for our students. I also want to thank the class of 2020 for their many years of hard work and outstanding contributions within our schools over the last 13 years. Although they will miss out on many rite of passage activities that go along with the end of high school, they still have provided a positive impact in our district community and generated many great memories through their years at North Platte.
